question: Will the Yuan be worth less than $0.15 USD by August 1, 2022?
description:
The government of the People's Republic of China has been intimating that a Yuan valued too highly against the United States Dollar may harm its economy.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the dollar price/exchange rate of one Chinese Yuan Renminbi (CNY) falls below $0.150000 at any time between March 22, 2022, and the resolution time of August 1, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, and “No” otherwise. 

The primary resolution source for this market will be xe.com (https://www.xe.com/currencycharts/?from=CNY&to=USD&view=1M). This market will resolve on midmarket prices with a 10-min resolution; however, the "low" price for the time period of this market (March 22, 2022 - August 1, 2022) will be sufficient.

If the primary resolution source is unavailable or inaccurate during the market timeframe, other credible sources may be considered.

question: NBA: Who will win Bucks vs. Bulls, scheduled for April 5 (8 PM ET)?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for April 5:

If the Milwaukee Bucks win, the market will resolve to “Bucks.” 

If the Chicago Bulls win, the market will resolve to “Bulls.” 

If the game is not completed by April 12, 2022 (11:59:59 PM ET), the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Cricket: Who will win South Africa vs. Bangladesh, 2nd Test WTC, starting on April 8?
description:
Test cricket is a format of cricket with the longest match duration and is considered the game's highest standard. Test matches are played between national representative teams that have been granted Test status (by the International Cricket Council) and may last up to five days.

The 2021–2023 ICC World Test Championship (WTC) started on August 4 2021 and is scheduled to finish on March 31 2023. New Zealand are the defending champions.

This market will resolve to whichever national team wins the WTC's 2nd Test game South Africa vs. Bangladesh scheduled to commence on April 8, 2022, 3 AM ET.

If the game is declared to be tied, abandoned, has "no result" or doesn't finish before April 19 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET - this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Bongbong Marcos be elected President of the Philippines in 2022?
description:
This market asks if candidate Bongbong Marcos will win the Philippines presidential election scheduled to take place on May 9, 2022. If Bongbong Marcos is elected president of Philippines in 2022, this market will resolve to “Yes”. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve on the earliest date that there is a definitive winner of the 2022 Philippines presidential election. The main resolution source will be official announcements by the government of the Republic of the Philippines (https://comelec.gov.ph/, https://www.gov.ph/ etc.) but credible media sources will also suffice. If a definitive winner of the 2022 Philippines presidential election is not determined by January 1, 2023, 12:00:00 PM ET, this market will resolve to 50-50.

question: Will Sarah Palin win Alaska's special election for the U.S. House?
description:
Don Young, ex-representative from Alaska, died on March 18, 2022 after 49 years of unbroken service as the US House representative for Alaska's at-large congressional district. This has triggered an Alaskan special election to fill his vacated seat. Sarah Palin has recently announced her intention to run in this election.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if ex-Governor of Alaska Sarah Louise Palin wins the special election for Alaska's at-large congressional seat in the U.S. House of Representatives scheduled to take place August 16, 2022. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Determination of the winners for the 2022 special election for the House Representative from Alaska will be based on a consensus of credible reporting; or, if there is ambiguity, the final state election authority certification or other final official determination of the 2022 special election results.

If no special election for House Representative from Alaska is held by October 14, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to 50-50.

question: Golf: Will an American win the 2022 Masters Tournament?
description:
The Masters Tournament is the first of four major championships in professional golf in 2022. It is always played at the same location, Augusta National Golf Club, a private golf course located in Augusta, Georgia, USA. Scheduled for the first full week in April, it will be held over April 4-10 in 2022.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if an American wins the 2022 Masters Tournament. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

The player list available here https://www.masters.com/en_US/players/player_list.html will be referenced; specifically whether a player has "United States" beneath their name.

The primary resolution sources will be official information from the Masters Tournament (https://www.masters.com/en_US/scores/index.html) and/or the Augusta National Golf Club.

If the 2022 Masters Tournament is cancelled, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: Golf: Who will win the 2022 Masters Tournament?

question: Will US student loan payments resume by Election Day, 2022?
description:
This market asks whether repayment of federal student loans in the United States of America will resume by November 8, 2022.

If federal student loan repayments resume in the US for all federal student loans at any time between April 5, 2022, and November 8, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET (inclusive), this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market's resolution, "federal student loan repayments resuming" means any one or all of these conditions being issued by the federal government of the United States of America regarding student loans:
1) Loan repayments will be resumed
2) The interest rate will be above 0%
3) Collections on default loans will be resumed

The primary resolution source for this market will be https://studentaid.gov/announcements-events/covid-19/payment-pause-zero-interest, however other official information from the government of the United States of America and credible reporting will be considered.
